resources.string:
To functional properly, Cache Cleaner needs your permission. Go to Settings to allow permission for Accessibility. 

 1. Go to Accessibility in Settings. 
 2. Find Cache Cleaner and tap on it. 
 3. Grant permission. 

 Accessibility services declaration: 
 - This application requires the Accessibility Services API to implement its core functions, such as performing clicks, swipes and other core functions. 
 - The Accessibility permission is required for Android 6 and above. 
 - This application does not collect and/or share personal or sensitive data using the Accessibility capabilities.

To functional properly, Cache Cleaner needs your permission. Go to Settings to allow permission for Accessibility. 

 1. Go to Accessibility in Settings. 
 2. Find Cache Cleaner and tap on it. 
 3. Grant permission. 

 Accessibility services declaration: 
 - This application requires the Accessibility Services API to implement its core functions, such as performing clicks, swipes and other core functions. 
 - The Accessibility permission is required for Android 6 and above. 
 - This application does not collect and/or share personal or sensitive data using the Accessibility capabilities. 

 Allow restricted settings: 
 - Since Android 13 Accessibility APIs is restricted for 3rd party apps. Please read the Warning ⚠️ paragraph in the Help menu.

"Cache Cleaner" requires the Accessibility Services API to implement its core functions, such as performing clicks, swipes and other core functions. "Cache Cleaner" does not collect and/or share personal or sensitive data using the Accessibility capabilities.

To functional properly, Cache Cleaner needs your permission. Go to Settings to allow permission for Usage Stats. 

 1. Go to Apps in Settings. 
 2. Find Special app access and tap on it. 
 3. Find Usage access and tap on it. 
 4. Find Cache Cleaner and tap on it. 
 5. Grant permission. 

 Usage stats declaration: 
 - This application requires the Usage stats to implement its core function, such as get cache size of installed applications. 
 - The Usage stats permission is required for Android 8 and above. 
 - This application does not collect and/or share personal or sensitive data using the Usage stats.
Hold the app icon to launch <App Info>
Enter the min. cache size for application filtering (KB,MB,GB,TB)
Please enter min. cache size in KB,MB,GB,TB OR 0 to reset default

Cache Cleaner was interrupted by the Android System while cleaning the %s app. Would you like to add this app to the list of ignored apps to prevent it from being included in future cleaning processes? You can always remove this app from the list of ignored apps in the Settings.

Customized Settings UI


Many companies or Android ROMs add or change default Android UI, including Settings. This can cause an issue because the Cache Cleaner app is looking for specific text and if it does not match, the app does nothing.
I confirm that I will read the chapter Customized Settings UI in the Help menu, before performing any actions with the Cache Cleaner app.

I confirm that if the Cache Cleaner does not perform any actions, I will undertake the actions described in the Help menu in the chapter Customized Settings UI, related to setting alternative text for searching the Storage and Cache or Storage menu, as well as setting alternative text for searching the Clear Cache button.

I confirm that if the Cache Cleaner does not perform any actions, I will change the cache clearing scenario in the Settings from the Default scenario to the Xiaomi MIUI scenario if my phone is a Xiaomi with specific regional MIUI firmware.

I confirm that if the Cache Cleaner does not perform any of the above-described actions, I am obligated to report my problem at the address specified in the chapter Submit a bug report in the Help menu.

I confirm that if the Cache Cleaner does not perform any of the above-described actions, and after reporting my issue at the address specified in the chapter Submit a bug report in the Help menu, I do not receive any support from the author, I can file a complaint through GooglePlay against the Cache Cleaner app, as an application that misleads users.

I confirm that if the Cache Cleaner does not perform any of the above-described actions, and after filing a complaint through GooglePlay against the Cache Cleaner app, I am obligated to leave a review on GooglePlay related to my issue.
I confirm that if I do not perform any of the above-listed actions, I completely renounce my right to leave negative feedback or complaints about misleading users.
If I do not agree with any of the above-listed actions, I am obligated to delete the Cache Cleaner app from my device and have no claims against it and the author.

About app


Since Android 6 (Marshmallow) it is no longer possible to clear cache of all apps at same time and Google has moved this permission to system apps only. There is only one possible way left - open manually info about application and find specific "Storage" menu and then press "Clean cache" button.

Cache Cleaner app can request all installed user and system apps and it replaces all manual actions related to clean cache using Accessibility service.

Warning ⚠️


Since Android 13 Accessibility APIs is restricted for 3rd party apps. Please follow the steps below to enable Accessibility for Cache Cleaner app.

Allow restricted settings


When you enable restricted settings, you allow apps to get access to sensitive info that could put your personal data at risk. We don’t recommend that you allow restricted settings unless you trust the app developer.

Some legitimate apps might ask you to enable restricted settings. For example, an app that’s designed to support people with disabilities might ask you to turn on accessibility settings. With access to accessibility settings, the app can read content on your screen and interact with apps on your behalf.

1. Click Open App Settings button below
2. Tap menu More ⋮ (top right corner)
3. Tap Allow restricted settings
4. Follow the on-screen instructions

Source - https://support.google.com/android/answer/12623953

How to use


1. Click button clean cache of User Apps, System Apps OR All Apps
2. Enable Usage Stats support for Cache Cleaner app if it is required
3. Enable Accessibility support for Cache Cleaner app if it is required
4. Check required apps in list (use floating button to check/uncheck all apps)
5. Press Clean Cache floating button to run cache clean process
6. Press Accessibility overlay button to interrupt process OR wait until process will be finished
7. (optional) Press Stop Accessibility service to disable Accessibility service

Customized Settings UI


Many companies or Android ROMs add or change default Android UI, including Settings. This can cause an issue because the Cache Cleaner app is looking for specific text and if it does not match, the app does nothing.

Please follow the steps below to resolve clear cache issue:

1. Select any app and go to "App Info"
2. Write down text for "Storage" menu
3. Go to "Storage" menu
4. Write down text for "Clear Cache" button
5. Open Cache Cleaner app with specific locale (change on required locale in Settings and go back into Cache Cleaner app)
6. Open Settings menu in the top right corner and find section Add Extra Search Text
7. Tap on Clear Cache, enter the custom search text for "Clear Cache" button" in input field and press "OK" to save it. To remove custom search text for "Clear Cache" button" just erase a whole text in input field and press "OK"
8. Tap on Storage, enter the custom search text for "Storage" menu" in input field and press "OK" to save it. To remove custom search text for "Storage" menu" just erase a whole text in input field and press "OK"

Xiaomi smartphones with specific regional MIUI firmware must use the different clear cache scenario:

1. Open Settings menu in the top right corner and find section Other
2. Click Clear cache scenario and select Xiaomi MIUI

ATTENTION ⚠️: Huawei and Xiaomi smartphones often use aggressive battery optimization that can disrupt communication between Cache Cleaner and the Accessibility service, preventing them from working as expected. Please follow the steps below:

1. Open Settings menu in the top right corner and find section Show extra buttons
2. Enable option Start/Stop Accessibility service
3. The next time you start Cache Cleaner, if the Accessibility service is running, stop it by clicking Stop Accessibility service button. Then, enable it again by clicking Start Accessibility service button

Icon copyright

Freepik license for monochrome Broom icon

Opening AppInfo of any app causes an error in Android 14. After opening too many AppInfo instances, the Android system goes into undefined behavior. Sorry, but this dialog will be shown until Google fixes the bug in Android 14.
The entered name already exists, please use another name
The list is empty, add at least one app
Min. cache size to filter apps
Please enter min. cache size in KB,MB,GB,TB OR 0 to reset filter
Edit the list of ignored apps
For some smartphones, you need to manually start or stop the accessibility service
For some smartphones, you need to manually stop the accessibility service and close the app
Automatically stop the Accessibility service after clearing the cache
Automatically close the app after clearing the cache
Add a new custom list of apps
Edit an existing custom list of apps
Remove an existing custom list of apps
For older smartphones, it is advisable to increase the timeout between apps, as the Android System may cause interruptions
For old smartphones, you should increase the timeout because the cache size calculation can take much longer
Max. timeout to wait Clear Cache button - %ds
For old smartphones, you should increase the timeout because the cache size calculation can take much longer
App does not have rights to write on external storage
